sentences.sContent: It’s impossible to predict what will happen next.
sentences.sCn: 不可能预测接下来会发生什么。

sentences.sContent: She carried on as if nothing had happened.
sentences.sCn: 她继续干，似乎什么都未曾发生。

sentences.sContent: This was bound to happen sooner or later.
This kind of thing happens all the time.
We’ll still be friends, whatever happens.
sentences.sCn: 不管发生什么，我们仍然是朋友。

sentences.sContent: ...which wouldn't happen without the pressure of an in-class exam...
...What does the speaker say will happen to people who lack sleep...
...What would happen to big restaurant chains that violate the new rule...
...What would happen if everyone stopped paying taxes...
...What will happen when the proposed measure come into effect...
...What will happen to the press operator who was late for the work according to the woman...
...She said that would never happen in Italy...
...What might happen to Claudette after this year’s American presidential election...
...The editor is amazed at how quickly Smith gets his stories only minutes after they happen - but soon he's presented with a contract to sign...

words.tran: 偶然的；随便的；无计划的

trans.tranOther: when something happens, there is an event, especially one that is not planned
